critique: This document establishes a naval defensive sea area and airspace reservation around Culebra Island, Puerto Rico, for national defense purposes. It restricts access to these areas to only public vessels and aircraft of the United States, unless authorized by the Secretary of the Navy. The order is justified by referencing section 44 of the Criminal Code and section 4 of the Air Commerce Act. It prioritizes national security by restricting access to a specific area for military purposes. There is a slight expansion of executive power as it gives the Secretary of Navy the authority to regulate access and enforce the order. There is no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, federalism implications, economic regulation, or social inclusion aspects. Therefore, these aspects are scored as neutral.
